Pencarian Penyelam China yang Tenggelam Diperluas
06 Nov 2019, 21:57 by Bunaiya Fauzi Arubone


Pencarian Penyelam China yang Tenggelam Diperluas

KBRN, Jakarta : Memasuki hari ketiga, pencarian terhadap tiga penyelam Warga Negara Asing (WNA) asal China yang diduga tenggelam di sekitar Pulau Sangiang, Banten, masih terus dilakukan. Luasan areal pencarian pun terus ditingkatkan.Kepala Badan SAR Nasional (Basarnas) Banten, M. Zainal Arifin menjelaskan, pada hari ketiga ini, luasan areal pencarian sudah mencapai 922,5 nautical mile square."Untuk hari ini kita sudah lakukan pencarian kurang lebih sekitar 922,5 nautical mile square," katanya saat berbincang dengan Radio Republik Indonesia, Rabu (6/11/2019).Dijelaskannya, pencarian dilakukan tidak hanya di permukaan laut, melainkan juga melalui jalur udara dan pencarian di bawah laut. Adapun areal pencarian terus diperluas karena mereka memperkirakan korban bisa saja terseret arus hingga jauh."Kalau dengan data kita sih memang relatif agak jauh," ujarnya.Lebih lanjut ditekankanya, sesuai dengan standar operasional prosedur (SOP), proses pencarian akan dilakukan hingga hari ke tujuh nanti. (Foto: Basarnas.go.id)

The Search for Drowned Chinese Divers Expands
Nov 6, 2019, 21:57 by Bunaiya Fauzi Arubone


The Search for Drowned Chinese Divers Expands

KBRN, Jakarta: Entering the third day, the search for three foreigners of Chinese foreigners suspected of drowning around Sangiang Island, Banten, is still ongoing. The extent of the search area continues to be increased. Head of the National SAR Agency (Basarnas) Banten, M. Zainal Arifin explained, on this third day, the area of the search area has reached 922.5 nautical mile square. "For today we have done a search of approximately approximately "922.5 nautical mile square," he said while speaking with Radio Republik Indonesia, Wednesday (11/06/2019). The search area continues to be expanded because they estimate that the victims could be drifted far to far. "If our data is indeed relatively rather far," he said. He further emphasized, in accordance with standard operating procedures (SOP), the search process will be carried out until the day seven later. (Photo: Basarnas.go.id)
